alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Quay County; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 29 at 8:40AM MDT until October 29 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Freezing fog this morning will turn more to periods of very light snow this afternoon. A light glaze of ice is possible. * WHERE...Curry County, Quay County, Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass, and Union County. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses will likely become slick and hazardous. Areas of dense freezing fog will reduce visibility below one half mile at times. This includes portions of I-40 and I-25 at Raton Pass.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Curry County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Quay County; Union County
